entry.title: SAP PI PO Migration
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement to migrate PI PO, but we don't have an Integration Suite with us currently. We wanted to have a plan before we start the migration. What are the alternatives i have.

When i do a migration assessment, do all the data from PO get transferred to IS? I wanted to understand the data flow; in case we decide to try with trial or free tier accounts.
Regards,
Keerthana

entry.title: Fetch Request token or ID Token from OAuth Grant Code Authentication
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are doing integration with OpenText system via SAP Integration Suite Cloud Integration. OpenText accepts only ID_Token to authenticate. We have an App which is registered in the Microsoft Azure and we generated the Client Credentials in the App. We use the microsoft login OAuth API initially to get the Access, Refresh and ID_Token and then use this ID_token to authenticate and call other OpenText API's. 

The solution is possible if I generate the refresh token in POSTMAN then use it in my Stored artifacts to generate another refresh token everytime. But I want to make this dynamic. 

I used the function getAccesTokenForOauth2AuthorizationCodeCredential to get the Access Token, but this does not return me the Refresh Token or ID_Token which is available along with the Access_Token. I tried to use the authentication using POSTMAN and the response JSON contains all these Tokens. Is there another way to get the all Tokens? Does SAP has another function with supports this? This is a critical factor for one of our integrations with OpenText which only accepts ID_Token containing the User Context.

entry.title: SAP Event Mesh & Integration Suite iFlow ‚Äì Webhook Handshake Problem
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

Is it possible to manage the handshake process within SAP Integration Suite?

Specifically, how do you handle HTTP OPTIONS requests within the iFlow?

We‚Äôve noticed that when triggering a handshake via a webhook, the Integration Suite logs capture the OPTIONS request, but we‚Äôre unsure how to properly handle or respond to it within the flow logic.

Any insights or best practices would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Event Mesh not visible
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to do the exercise for SAP BTP integration developer and currently going through the course module Introducing Event-Driven Architectures - https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/developing-with-sap-integration-suite/introducing-event-driven-architectures

I am trying to do the exercise for adding 'Manage Business Event' capability in my integration Suite. But I cannot add that capability as that capability is not present in my Integration Suite. I am using trial account.

I tried to check if its role missing and I can see that I am not able to see any role related to event mesh in  ‚ÄòAssign Role collection‚Äô section against my userid.

After researching a bit, I thought may be the entitlement for event mesh is missing in my sub account and I was trying to add the entitlement, and I cannot see event mesh in entitlements as well

Please help me resolve this issue.

entry.title: Integration of SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere using JDBC
entry.content:
Integration Between SAP CPI and SAP DataSphere (JDBC Connection)  
 
JDBC ‚Äì JAVA DATABASE CONNECTIVITY 
 
Why Recommendation for JDBC Over OData API : 
JDBC is recommended over OData when consuming large-scale records (e.g., 100,000+) because JDBC streams data directly from the database with better performance and less overhead, while OData is optimized for lightweight, paginated, service-based access. 
 
Problem statement: 3337495 - OData API returns less records than expected due paging 
Pagination limits in OData and Ariba APIs can be handled in SAP CPI using a looping process call. 
 
Goal: Connect CPI to a database used by DataSphere (JDBC) and run a simple read data from the (Analytical Model / Table /View).  
 
For the Write / Delete / Update method, the attached SAP Help Portal Link has syntax in the reference section. 
 
Prerequisites: 

  1. SAP DataSphere ‚Äì Subscribed account (‚ö† Trial has limited features, JDBC not supported) 
  1. SAP Integration Suite ‚Äì Subscribed or Trial (JDBC actions supported) 

 

SAP DataSphere Step by Step Guide : 
 

Step 

Action / Notes 

1. Create a Space 

DataSphere ‚Üí Space Management ‚Üí New Space ‚Üí Name it ‚Üí Create. 

2. Create Table / Analytical Model 

Data Builder ‚Üí In your Space ‚Üí New ‚Üí Table or Analytical Model ‚Üí define fields & data types ‚Üí Save & Publish. 
*Verify Table/Model Deployed Successfully. * 

3. Prepare / Load Data 

Load data manually for testing cases. Otherwise load CSV/import to table via Data Builder/Data Integration. 

4. Note Schema & Object Names 

Record schema name, table name, and view names for JDBC SQL use. 
* Created space name is the SCHEMA name and Collect Table / Model name * 

5. Decide Where to Create DB User 

If HANA Cloud ‚Üí use HANA Cockpit/DB Explorer. If on-prem DB ‚Üí use DB admin tools or contact DB Admin. 
* We are using the HANA cloud system for practical session* 

6. Create JDBC DB User 

DB admin tool ‚Üí Security/Users ‚Üí New User ‚Üí set username & strong password ‚Üí Save. 
*Check Active status of User* 

7. Grant Privileges for the DB user 

Assign only required privileges (e.g., SELECT for read; add INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE for CRUD). Best practice: create role JDBC_ROLE and assign. 

8. Prepare JDBC Connection Details 

Gather JDBC URL (e.g.  sample URL from datasphere: z*********-abc.hana.prod-eu10.hanacloud.ondemand.com 
Format for CPI JDBC Material: 
jdbc:sap://<host>:<port>/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true 

 
SAP Integration Suite Step by Step Guide : 
 
Create a Package & Artifact 

  • In CPI ‚Üí Design ‚Üí Create a new package ‚Üí Add an integration flow artifact. 
  • ‚úÖ Make sure your CPI user has the required roles to create and access design-time artifacts. 
     

Go to Monitoring ‚Üí JDBC Material 

  • In CPI ‚Üí Monitor ‚Üí Integrations and APIs ‚Üí Manage Security ‚Üí JDBC Material

     

     
  • ‚Üí Add JDBC Data Source. ‚Üí Select HANA cloud  

     

     
     
  • Provide JDBC URL in the correct format (e.g., jdbc:sap://<hana-host>:443/?encrypt=true&validateCertificate=true). 

     

     
  • Enter DB username and password (use the dedicated JDBC user created earlier in DataSphere). 

     

     
  • Save and deploy the JDBC material. 
    •  

    Apply JDBC Material in iFlow

    • In your integration flow, configure the JDBC receiver adapter ‚Üí select the JDBC data source created.
    • Use SQL queries (SELECT) in the Processing tab or provide XML query body. Here, I‚Äôm using SQL SELECT * to fetch all records from the table.

     


    Step 1: Timer Start
     In this iFlow, the Start Timer is configured with a Simple Schedule ‚Üí None ‚Üí On Deployment, which means the integration flow automatically triggers immediately after deployment.

     


    Step 2: Content Modifier
    Use this SQL query to fetch all records with the body operation.
     SELECT * FROM "<Schema>"."<Model/TableName>"

     



    Step 3: Request Reply & JDBC Receiver Adapter
         ‚Üí Use the deployed JDBC Data Source alias in the JDBC Material in the previous step and set Max records count based on your requirement.
    ‚Üí JDBC Maximum Records per call:  2,147,483,647

     


    Sample data Response from JDBC Connection:

     



    References :

    CPI JDBC ‚Äì XML Query in Body for CRUD Operations (Syntax Guide)
     link:
    https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-integration/sap-cloud-integration/payload-and-operation

entry.title: Issue enabling Splunk external logging for Integration Suite
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

We are trying to enable External Logging in our Integration Suite tenant to Splunk Enterprise system. We have completed all the configuration in Cloud Connector and BTP Destinations. While invoking the API api/v1/activateExternalLogging, we are receiving response with below error:

   {
      "description": "Polling Splunk HTTP Event Collector Endpoint",
      "result": "ERROR",
      "dataSent": "POST /services/collector/event",
      "dataReceived": "Not Found:\n{\"message\":\"could not find parser\"}"
    }

We have tried Splunk end point from postman and it was successfully executed. Cloud Connector and BTP Destination - Check configurations are also successful. 

We have rechecked all the configurations and unable to identify why we are receiving this error while activating external logging.

Any inputs are sincerely appreciated.

entry.title: Conversion of the payload to NDJSON
entry.content:
Hello all,

I am wondering if anyone was dealing with a conversion to New Delimited JSON in the iFlow, it is pretty new, and I haven't found any standard tool in the CPI yet /still working on NEO environment/.

Can anyone advise how to convert this? 

{
 "UsersPayload": {
                                  "User": [
                                                 {
                                                    "userId": "XXXXX",
                                                    "manager": "YYYYY"
                                                 },
                                                {
                                                   "userId": "ZZZZZ",
                                                   "manager": "YYYYY"
                                                }
                                                ]
                                }
}
This shall be the JAVA statement that does the magic
const ndjson = jsonData.map(item => JSON.stringify(item)).join('\n');
The trick is to try to convert that to Groovy.
 
Thank you,
Best Regards,
Dagmar

entry.title: Plan for migration of interfaces to SAP Cloud Integration(Int. Suite)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are in to aumotive industry,, This is regarding our ongoing plan to replace all the existing PO/PI instances with the shared SAP Cloud Integration(Int. Suite). As you know, we currently have Team A, Team B, Team C, , each using their own SAP PO/PI system, SAP backends, and individual integration teams. Say for example team A ; team B ;; team C ;;   Also each team has its distinct partner system or common partner system &  common plants between each two teams.  I have the following questions in terms of better architecture, implementation, design, stability, future proof, and operations etc.,

(i) Would it be beneficial for each team to migrate their ICOs to their own Pipeline concept iFlows.

(ii) Should we migrate interfaces system by system (or) plant by plant in a phased manner.

(iii) Standardization and Consistency, Operational Efficiency, Resource Management and Faster Migration (Long-Term), better integration patterns and reducing the complexity etc.

Regards,

Ramu.

entry.title: SAP CPI - IBMMQ adapter setup MQRC_JSSE_ERROR.
entry.content:
I need help understanding why IBM MQ adapter in CPI does not connect to MQ server due to SSL/TLS problems with MQRC_JSSE_ERROR.

Using WebSphere MQ 9.3.0.5 on Windows.

Steps to setup:
1. Create self-signed cert on MQ Server, 

runmqakm -keydb -create -db srt04684.kdb -pw <secret> -type cms -stash

runmqakm -cert -create -db srt04684.kdb  -pw <secret> -label ibmwebspheremqqm1010t -dn "CN=srt04684,C=SE"  -size 2048  -x509version 3 -expire 730 -sig_alg SHA256WithRSA

runmqakm -cert -extract -db srt04684.kdb -pw <secret> -label ibmwebspheremqqm1010t -target srt04684.arm -format ascii

2. Config QMGR, including copying certificate files to /ssl directory and updating QMGR SSL key repository (excluding .kbd), setting the password and also setting the certificate label to "ibmwebspheremqqm1010t"

3. Create SVRCONN channel SAPISCLIENT.CH, set CipherSpec to "TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256" (have tried multiple others). No SSL Authentication.

4. Restart QMGR

5.Config cloud connector, with virtual name matching the servername "srt04684", port 1414. Verified connectivity

6. Added public Cert that was exported in MQ server to SAP CPI keystore. Named it "srt04684".

7. Created iFlow with the following parameters in IBMMQ Sender subscribe:

Hostname: srt04684
Port: 1414
Proxy type: Om Premise
SSL Cipher Suite: TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256
QueueManagerName: QM1010T
Channel name: SAPISCLIENT.CH

Error on CPI:

[CONTENT][CONTENT_DEPLOY][RuntimeError] : {"message":"POLL_FAILED","childMessageInstances":[{"message":"EXCEPTION","parameters":["org.apache.camel.CamelException: Error message: An error occurred while starting or stopping JMS Connection. Reason: JMSCMQ0001: IBM MQ call failed with compcode '2' ('MQCC_FAILED') reason '2397' ('MQRC_JSSE_ERROR').."]}],"parameters":["IBMMQ://JMS_SUBSCRIBE?authentication=none&ccsid=1208&channelName=SAPISCLIENT.CH&cipherSuitCloudConn=TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256&connectionProtocol=tcpip&delay=300000&entit ... [truncated

I have also tried to create a certificate with CN=qm1010t but not succeeded with that.
I have tried multiple SSL Cipher values including *ANY, *TLS12ORHIGHER,  and others...

Any help is appreciated.

Regards
Andreas

entry.title: CPI Integration Flow: Weather Alert using Open-Meteo API (cities list loop + email notification)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am working on a scenario in which I want to build an automated iFlow in SAP Cloud Platform Integration (CPI) to send weather alerts. The requirements are as follows:

 

  • Read a list of cities (e.g., Nagpur, Mumbai, Delhi)

  • For each city:

     

    • Fetch latitude & longitude dynamically using the Open-Meteo Geocoding API

    • Then call the Open-Meteo Weather API using those coordinates

    • Read the current temperature value

    • Check for conditions:

      • If temperature > 35 ¬∞C ‚Üí ‚ÄúHigh Temperature Alert‚Äù

      • If temperature < 5 ¬∞C ‚Üí ‚ÄúLow Temperature Alert‚Äù

    • Send an email notification with the city name, temperature and the alert message

I have started designing the iFlow with a Timer, looping splitter, HTTP calls, Groovy scripts for extraction and condition logic, and an Email receiver adapter.

What I need help with:

  • Best practice for looping through a list of cities in CPI (should I use an array in a Content Modifier, external CSV, or OData?)

  • How to correctly map and extract the response from the Geocoding API (first result latitude/longitude) ‚Üí any sample Groovy script or mapping advice would be great

  • How to structure the error handling when an API returns no result or the city name is not found

  • Any suggestions for optimizing the iFlow for performance, especially if the list of cities grows to ~50+

I will also attach a screenshot of my current iFlow configuration (Timer, Splitter, content modifier, HTTP channel, etc.) to show where I am stuck.

If anyone is available and open to help or review the design with me, I would greatly appreciate it. Thank you in advance for your time and advice!

Regards,
Safar

entry.title: How To get compliant with iFlow Design Guidelines - Define Identifiers To Search In Message
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

I use the designguidelines when creating iFlows, but there is one point where I am unable to achieve compliance.

It concerns the following point in the Design Guidelines: Define Identifiers To Search In Message Processing Logs.

My current approach:

At the beginning of the iFlow, I have implemented a Groovy script that stores important values for identifying the customer in the CustomHeaderProperty.

Unfortunately, this does not seem to be enough to make me compliant with the Design Guidelines under ‚ÄòDefine Identifiers To Search In Message Processing Logs‚Äô.

Here is the Groovy script I used:

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message;

def Message processData(Message message) {
    
	def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message);
	if(messageLog != null){

		def sEquiID = message.getHeaders().get("EquiID");		
		if(sSapAuthenticatedUserName!=null){
			messageLog.addCustomHeaderProperty("EquiID", sEquiID);		
        }

		def sOrderID = message.getHeaders().get("OrderID");		
		if(sSapAuthenticatedUserName!=null){
			messageLog.addCustomHeaderProperty("OrderID", sOrderID);		
        }

	}
	return message;
}

 

Do you have any idea what else I need to do?

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: API Execution Failed When Trying to Use ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù Feature in SAP Cloud Integration API on BTP Trial
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I recently ran into an issue while experimenting with SAP Cloud Integration on my SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Trial Account, and I wanted to share my experience here in case anyone else has faced something similar‚Äîor if someone can point me in the right direction.

Scenario

As part of my learning journey in SAP Integration Suite, I created an Integration Flow (iFlow) in Cloud Integration (CPI) and successfully deployed it.

Then, I exposed the iFlow as an API through the API Management capability of BTP so that I could access it externally via a REST API call.

Everything went smoothly until I tried to test the API using the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature from SAP API Business Hub.

Steps Followed

  1. Logged in to my SAP BTP Trial account.

  2. Opened Integration Suite ‚Üí Cloud Integration.

  3. Created and deployed an iFlow that returns some sample data.

  4. Exposed the iFlow as an API Proxy using API Management ‚Üí Design ‚Üí API Proxies.

  5. Opened the Cloud Integration API package on SAP API Business Hub.

  6. Clicked ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù to test one of the APIs (for example, /MessageProcessingLogs).

  7. Given the clientid and clientsecret from instance default_it-rt_integration-flow and also I tried with my BTP sign inuser id and password and it shows API execution failed. Please try again.

    Issue Facing

    When I clicked Execute, the system returned the following message:

    API execution failed. Please try again.

    No additional error details were displayed in the response window, and the API call did not reach my iFlow endpoint.

    Troubleshooting Attempted

    Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve tried so far:

    • Verified that the iFlow is deployed and active.

    • Checked the runtime URL from the Monitor ‚Üí Manage Integration Content page.

    • Verified that my trial tenant is active and not in suspended state.

    • Checked API Business Hub ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature for other packages ‚Äî same issue occurs, which might indicate an environment limitation.

      My Understanding So Far

      It seems that the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature on SAP API Business Hub might not support BTP Trial environments for certain APIs, especially those requiring authenticated connections to Cloud Integration runtime.

      In a productive BTP setup (non-trial), the ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù function usually works fine when proper credentials and destinations are configured.

      Request for Help

      Has anyone successfully used the Cloud Integration API ‚ÄúTry Out‚Äù feature with a Trial account?
      If so, could you please share:

      • Any specific configuration or destination settings needed for trial accounts

      • Whether OAuth token-based authentication is mandatory

      • Or if this limitation is by design for BTP Trial users

        Conclusion

        I‚Äôm learning a lot about SAP Integration Suite and the API Management capabilities on BTP.
        Even though I‚Äôve hit this roadblock, it‚Äôs been a great opportunity to understand how authentication and API exposure work behind the scenes in the SAP ecosystem.

        Would love to hear from the community if anyone has faced and resolved this issue! üôå

entry.title: Is It Time to Bring AI Workflows Into SAP Automation?
entry.content:
I‚Äôve been experimenting lately with ways to bring more autonomy into SAP workflows. Most automation setups still rely on rules or triggers, they do what they‚Äôre told, but they don‚Äôt adapt when data or processes change.

What‚Äôs been fascinating is how much potential there is in combining SAP process automation with AI-driven decision logic. Imagine workflows that can detect anomalies in purchase orders, reroute approvals based on context, or sync data intelligently with non-SAP systems without manual rules.

The challenge I keep running into is how to design these ‚ÄúAI-aware‚Äù workflows without adding too much complexity or breaking governance.

So I‚Äôm curious has anyone here tried integrating AI-driven workflows with SAP? Are you doing it through BTP, Integration Suite, or experimenting with other tools or APIs? What‚Äôs been working for you (and what hasn‚Äôt)?

Subhashini Rawat

entry.title: Why iFlow Replicate Sales Order and Sales Quote from SAP S4HANA only allows iDocs
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am currently working on a standard integration between SAP S/4HANA On-Premise and SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 for the replication of Sales Orders ‚Äì from S/4 to Sales Cloud v2.

I have come across something that seems completely inconsistent, and I cannot explain it:

1. In DRFIMG, the only outbound implementation for Sales Orders is 114_1 (Webservice)

In DRFIMG ‚Üí Define Outbound Implementations, the object SalesOrder only offers the Webservice outbound implementation 114_1.
There is no IDoc outbound option available.

2. The SAP standard iFlow for Sales Cloud v2, however, expects an IDoc structure

In the SAP Integration Suite package ‚ÄúSAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP S/4HANA‚Äù, the sender adapter for the iFlow ‚ÄúReplicate Sales Order and Sales Quote from SAP S/4HANA‚Äù must be configured as IDoc.
The iFlow clearly expects an IDoc XML payload.

If you send SOAP/Webservice messages instead, errors occur such as:

  • HTTP 401

  • unsupported xstream in SRT_MONI

Which makes sense, because the iFlow internally seems to process IDoc payloads only, not SOAP.

My question to the community:

How does this fit together?

  • Is this an intentional design?

  • Why is the iFlow still using IDoc structures here?

  • If DRFIMG does not provide an IDoc outbound implementation, how is this integration supposed to work?

  • What are the recommended options or best practices?

  • Any guidance or tips from someone who has implemented this scenario successfully would be greatly appreciated.
